document.heading: Office of Administrative Hearings Unemployment Appeals Extension Temporary Amendment Act of 2021

To amend section 812 of the Coronavirus Support Temporary Amendment Act of 2021 to extend the tolling of the time period to request a hearing from the Office of Administrative Appeals for unemployment compensation appeals.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Office of Administrative Hearings Unemployment Appeals Extension Temporary Amendment Act of 2021".

section.text: Section 812 of the Coronavirus Support Temporary Amendment Act of 2021, effective June 24, 2021 (D.C. Law 24-9; 68 DCR 4824) is amended to read as follows:

section.heading: Administrative hearings deadlines.
section.text: Notwithstanding any provision of District law, but subject to applicable federal laws and regulations, the time period to request an administrative hearing for an appeal of a determination of benefits eligibility for unemployment compensation pursuant to section 11(b) of An Act to provide for unemployment compensation in the District of Columbia, authorize appropriations, and for other purposes, approved August 28, 1935 (49 Stat 951; D.C. Official Code § 51-111(b)), shall be tolled.

codify:temporary.action: providing for administrative hearings deadlines during a public health emergency

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

para.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code § 1-206.03(c)(1)), and publication in the District of Columbia Register.
This act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
